verses.verse: (A Song, a Psalm of Asaph.) O God,<WH430> do not remain quiet;<WH1824> Do not be silent<WH2790> and, O God,<WH410> do not be still.<WH8252>
For, behold,<WH2009> Thine enemies<WH340> make<WH1993> an uproar;<WH1993> And those who hate<WH8130> Thee have exalted<WH5375> themselves.<WH7218>
They make<WH6191> shrewd<WH6191> plans<WH5475> against<WH5921> Thy people,<WH5971> And conspire<WH3289> together against<WH5921> Thy treasured<WH6845> ones.
They have said,<WH559> "Come,<WH1980> and let us wipe<WH3582> them out as a nation,<WH1471> That the name<WH8034> of Israel<WH3478> be remembered<WH2142> no<WH3808> more.<WH5750>"
For they have conspired<WH3289> together<WH9191> with one mind;<WH3820> Against<WH5921> Thee do they make<WH3772> a covenant: <WH1285>
The tents<WH168> of Edom<WH9000> and the Ishmaelites;<WH3459> Moab,<WH4124> and the Hagrites;<WH1905>
Gebal,<WH1381> and Ammon,<WH5983> and Amalek;<WH6002> Philistia<WH6429> with the inhabitants<WH3427> of Tyre;<WH6865>
Assyria<WH804> also<WH1571> has joined<WH3867> with them; They have<WH1961> become<WH1961> a help<WH2220> to the children<WH1121> of Lot.<WH3876> Selah.<WH5542>
Deal<WH6213> with them as with Midian,<WH4080> As with Sisera<WH5516> [and] Jabin,<WH2985> at the torrent<WH5158> of Kishon,<WH7028>
Who were destroyed<WH8045> at En-dor, Who became<WH1961> as dung<WH1828> for the ground.<WH127>
Make<WH7896> their nobles<WH5081> like Oreb<WH6159> and Zeeb,<WH2062> And all<WH3605> their princes<WH5257> like Zebah<WH2078> and Zalmunna,<WH6759>
Who<WH834> said,<WH559> "Let us possess<WH3423> for ourselves The pastures<WH4999> of God.<WH430>"
O my God,<WH430> make<WH7896> them like the whirling<WH1534> dust;<WH1534> Like chaff<WH7179> before<WH6440> the wind.<WH7307>
Like fire<WH784> that burns<WH1197> the forest,<WH9194> And like a flame<WH3852> that sets<WH3857> the mountains<WH2022> on fire,<WH3857>
So<WH3651> pursue<WH7291> them with Thy tempest,<WH5591> And terrify<WH926> them with Thy storm.<WH5492>
Fill<WH4390> their faces<WH6440> with dishonor,<WH7036> That they may seek<WH1245> Thy name,<WH8034> O Lord.<WH3068>
Let them be ashamed<WH954> and dismayed<WH926> forever;<WH5703> And let them be humiliated<WH2659> and perish,
That they may know<WH3045> that Thou alone,<WH905> whose name<WH8034> is the Lord,<WH3068> Art the Most<WH9411> High<WH9411> over<WH5921> all<WH3605> the earth.<WH776>
